dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 26.3 cm (10 3/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Herbert S. Langfeld and Mr. and Mrs. J. Merrill Knapp
inscribed:
Signature and address at bottom center: Ioha Strada inuen. / Phls Galle Excu.  

Two Bible verses in margin around: Et mittet Angelos... et nos immutabimur. 1 Corinthoreum. 15. 52.

caption: Hendrick Goltzius (1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands), after Jan van der Straet (Flemish, 1523–1605), Published by Philip Galle (1537–1612; born Haarlem, Netherlands; died Antwerp, Belgium), The Raising of the Dead, ca. 1578.
